step_1_context.text: Sara studies every evening and her brother plays football on weekends. These are regular habits.

step_2_explanation.simple_rule: Use present simple for habits, routines, and facts.
step_2_explanation.formula: Subject + base verb (add s/es for he/she/it)
step_2_explanation.common_mistake: Do not forget s/es with third person singular.

step_3_interactive_exercises.question: Which sentence is present simple and correct?
options: She go to work every day.
She goes to work every day.
She is go to work every day.
She going to work every day.
step_3_interactive_exercises.correct_answer: She goes to work every day.

step_3_interactive_exercises.incorrect_sentence: My father drive to work every day.
step_3_interactive_exercises.corrected_sentence: My father drives to work every day.
step_3_interactive_exercises.error_analysis: With he/she/it, add s or es to the main verb.
